content.question: If <math alttext="1.50 moles" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A g N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>AgNO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>s</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is added to the solution in the beaker and diluted to a final volume of <math alttext="1000 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following magnified views most accurately reflects the composition of the solution? (All magnified views represent the same volume of solution.)

choices.label: The figure presents 1000 milliliters of an A g N O 3 solution. A magnified view of the solution shows four A g with a positive 1 charge ions and four N O 3 with a negative 1 charge ions evenly dispersed across the area.

The figure presents 1000 milliliters of an A g N O 3 solution. A magnified view of the solution shows two A g with a positive 1 charge ions and two N O 3 with a negative 1 charge ions evenly dispersed across the area.

The figure presents 1000 milliliters of an A g N O 3 solution. A magnified view of the solution shows eight A g with a positive 1 charge ions and eight N O 3 with a negative 1 charge ions evenly dispersed across the area.

The figure presents 1000 milliliters of an A g N O 3 solution. A magnified view of the solution shows eight A g with a positive 1 charge ions dispersed across the area, and eight N O 3 with a negative 1 charge ions, each one almost touching one of the A g with a positive 1 charge ions.

content.answer: The figure presents 1000 milliliters of an A g N O 3 solution. A magnified view of the solution shows eight A g with a positive 1 charge ions and eight N O 3 with a negative 1 charge ions evenly dispersed across the area.
